bytebase.v1.BoundingBox.schema.strict.js.description: BoundingBox defines the spatial bounds for GEOMETRY spatial indexes.
bytebase.v1.BoundingBox.schema.strict.js.title: Bounding Box

bytebase.v1.CheckConstraintMetadata.sche.description: CheckConstraintMetadata is the metadata for check constraints.

expression.description: The expression is the expression of a check constraint.

name.description: The name is the name of a check constraint.

bytebase.v1.CheckConstraintMetadata.sche.title: Check Constraint Metadata

bytebase.v1.ColumnMetadata.schema.strict.description: ColumnMetadata is the metadata for columns.

character_set.description: The character_set is the character_set of a column.

collation.description: The collation is the collation of a column.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a column.

default_constraint_name.description:
Example: A column definition like:
   CREATE TABLE employees (
     status NVARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'active'
   )

 Will create a constraint with an auto-generated name like 'DF__employees__statu__3B75D760'
 or a user-defined name if specified:
   ALTER TABLE employees ADD CONSTRAINT DF_employees_status DEFAULT 'active' FOR status

 To modify the default, you must first drop the existing constraint by name:
   ALTER TABLE employees DROP CONSTRAINT DF__employees__statu__3B75D760
   ALTER TABLE employees ADD CONSTRAINT DF_employees_status DEFAULT 'inactive' FOR status

 This field is populated when syncing from the database. When empty (e.g., when parsing
 from SQL files), the system cannot automatically drop the constraint.
default_constraint_name.title:
The default_constraint_name is the name of the default constraint, MSSQL only.
 In MSSQL, default values are implemented as named constraints. When modifying or
 dropping a column's default value, you must reference the constraint by name.
 This field stores the actual constraint name from the database.

default_on_null.description:
Oracle specific metadata.
 The default_on_null is the default on null of a column.

generation.description: The generation is the generation of a column.

identity_generation.description: The identity_generation is for identity columns, PG only.
identity_generation.title: Identity Generation

identity_increment.description: The identity_increment is for identity columns, MSSQL only.

identity_seed.description: The identity_seed is for identity columns, MSSQL only.

name.description: The name is the name of a column.

nullable.description: The nullable is the nullable of a column.

on_update.description:
The on_update is the on update action of a column.
 For MySQL like databases, it's only supported for TIMESTAMP columns with
 CURRENT_TIMESTAMP as on update value.

position.description: The position is the position in columns.

type.description: The type is the type of a column.

bytebase.v1.ColumnMetadata.schema.strict.title: Column Metadata

bytebase.v1.DatabaseMetadata.schema.stri.description: DatabaseMetadata is the metadata for databases.

character_set.description: The character_set is the character set of a database.

collation.description: The collation is the collation of a database.

extensions.description: The extensions is the list of extensions in a database.

name.description: Format: instances/{instance}/databases/{database}/metadata
name.title: The database metadata name.

schemas.description: The schemas is the list of schemas in a database.

search_path.description: The search_path is the search path of a PostgreSQL database.

bytebase.v1.DatabaseMetadata.schema.stri.title: Database Metadata

bytebase.v1.DependencyColumn.schema.stri.description: DependencyColumn is the metadata for dependency columns.

column.description: The column is the name of a reference column.

schema.description: The schema is the schema of a reference column.

table.description: The table is the table of a reference column.

bytebase.v1.DependencyColumn.schema.stri.title: Dependency Column

schema.description: The schema is the schema of a reference table.

table.description: The table is the name of a reference table.

bytebase.v1.DimensionConstraint.schema.s.description: DimensionConstraint defines constraints for a spatial dimension.

dimension.description: Dimension name/type (X, Y, Z, M, etc.)

bytebase.v1.DimensionConstraint.schema.s.title: Dimension Constraint

bytebase.v1.DimensionalConfig.schema.str.description: DimensionalConfig defines dimensional and constraint parameters for spatial indexes.

data_type.description: Spatial data type (GEOMETRY, GEOGRAPHY, POINT, POLYGON, etc.)

bytebase.v1.DimensionalConfig.schema.str.title: Dimensional Config

comment.description: The comment describing the enum type.

name.description: The name of a type.

skip_dump.description: Whether to skip this enum type during schema dump operations.

values.description: The enum values of a type.

character_set_client.description: The character set used by the client creating the event.

collation_connection.description: The collation used for the connection when creating the event.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of an event.

name.description: The name of the event.

sql_mode.description: The SQL mode setting for the event.

time_zone.description: The time zone of the event.

bytebase.v1.ExtensionMetadata.schema.str.description: ExtensionMetadata is the metadata for extensions.

description.description: The description is the description of an extension.

name.description: The name is the name of an extension.

schema.description:
The schema is the extension that is installed to. But the extension usage
 is not limited to the schema.

version.description: The version is the version of an extension.

bytebase.v1.ExtensionMetadata.schema.str.title: Extension Metadata

columns.description: The columns is the ordered list of columns in a foreign table.

external_database_name.description: The external_database_name is the name of the external database.

external_server_name.description: The external_server_name is the name of the external server.

name.description: The name is the name of a external table.

bytebase.v1.ForeignKeyMetadata.schema.st.description: ForeignKeyMetadata is the metadata for foreign keys.

columns.description: The columns are the ordered referencing columns of a foreign key.

match_type.description:
The match_type is the match type of a foreign key.
 The match_type is the PostgreSQL specific field.
 It's empty string for other databases.

name.description: The name is the name of a foreign key.

on_delete.description: The on_delete is the on delete action of a foreign key.

on_update.description: The on_update is the on update action of a foreign key.

referenced_columns.description: The referenced_columns are the ordered referenced columns of a foreign key.

referenced_schema.description:
The referenced_schema is the referenced schema name of a foreign key.
 It is an empty string for databases without such concept such as MySQL.

referenced_table.description: The referenced_table is the referenced table name of a foreign key.

bytebase.v1.ForeignKeyMetadata.schema.st.title: Foreign Key Metadata

bytebase.v1.FunctionMetadata.schema.stri.description: FunctionMetadata is the metadata for functions.

definition.description: The definition is the definition of a function.

dependency_tables.description:
The dependency_tables is the list of dependency tables of a function.
 For PostgreSQL, it's the list of tables that the function depends on the return type definition.

name.description: The name is the name of a function.

signature.description:
The signature is the name with the number and type of input arguments the
 function takes.

bytebase.v1.FunctionMetadata.schema.stri.title: Function Metadata

bytebase.v1.GridLevel.schema.strict.json.description: GridLevel defines a tessellation grid level with its density.

level.description: Grid level number (1-4 for SQL Server)

bytebase.v1.GridLevel.schema.strict.json.title: Grid Level

bytebase.v1.IndexMetadata.schema.strict..description: IndexMetadata is the metadata for indexes.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of an index.

descending.description: The descending is the ordered descending of an index.

expressions.description:
The expressions are the ordered columns or expressions of an index.
 This could refer to a column or an expression.

granularity.description: The number of granules in the block. It's a ClickHouse specific field.

is_constraint.description:
It's a PostgreSQL specific field.
 The unique constraint and unique index are not the same thing in PostgreSQL.

key_length.description:
The key_lengths are the ordered key lengths of an index.
 If the key length is not specified, it's -1.

name.description: The name is the name of an index.

opclass_defaults.description: True if the operator class is the default. (PostgreSQL specific).

opclass_names.description:
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/catalog-pg-opclass.html
 Name of the operator class for each column. (PostgreSQL specific).

parent_index_name.description: The index name of the parent index.

parent_index_schema.description: The schema name of the parent index.

primary.description: The primary is whether the index is a primary key index.

spatial_config.description: Spatial index configuration for spatial databases like SQL Server, PostgreSQL with PostGIS, etc.

type.description: The type is the type of an index.

unique.description: The unique is whether the index is unique.

visible.description: The visible is whether the index is visible.

bytebase.v1.IndexMetadata.schema.strict..title: Index Metadata

bytebase.v1.MaterializedViewMetadata.sch.description: MaterializedViewMetadata is the metadata for materialized views.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a materialized view.

definition.description: The definition is the definition of a materialized view.

dependency_columns.description:
The dependency_columns is the list of dependency columns of a materialized
 view.

indexes.description: The indexes is the list of indexes in a table.

name.description: The name is the name of a materialized view.

triggers.description: The columns is the ordered list of columns in a table.

bytebase.v1.MaterializedViewMetadata.sch.title: Materialized View Metadata

bytebase.v1.PackageMetadata.schema.stric.description: PackageMetadata is the metadata for packages.

definition.description: The definition is the definition of a package.

name.description: The name is the name of a package.

bytebase.v1.PackageMetadata.schema.stric.title: Package Metadata

bytebase.v1.ProcedureMetadata.schema.str.description: ProcedureMetadata is the metadata for procedures.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a procedure.

definition.description: The definition is the definition of a procedure.

name.description: The name is the name of a procedure.

signature.description:
The signature is the name with the number and type of input arguments the
 procedure takes.

bytebase.v1.ProcedureMetadata.schema.str.title: Procedure Metadata

bytebase.v1.SchemaMetadata.schema.strict.description:
SchemaMetadata is the metadata for schemas.
 This is the concept of schema in Postgres, but it's a no-op for MySQL.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a schema.

enum_types.description: The enum_types is the list of user-defined enum types in a schema.

events.description: The events is the list of scheduled events in a schema.

external_tables.description: The external_tables is the list of external tables in a schema.

functions.description: The functions is the list of functions in a schema.

materialized_views.description: The materialized_views is the list of materialized views in a schema.

name.description:
The name is the schema name.
 It is an empty string for databases without such concept such as MySQL.

packages.description: The packages is the list of packages in a schema.

procedures.description: The procedures is the list of procedures in a schema.

sequences.description: The sequences is the list of sequences in a schema, sorted by name.

skip_dump.description: Whether to skip this schema during schema dump operations.

streams.description:
The streams is the list of streams in a schema, currently, only used for
 Snowflake.

tables.description: The tables is the list of tables in a schema.

tasks.description:
The routines is the list of routines in a schema, currently, only used for
 Snowflake.

views.description: The views is the list of views in a schema.

bytebase.v1.SchemaMetadata.schema.strict.title: Schema Metadata

cycle.description: Cycle is whether the sequence cycles.

data_type.description: The data type of a sequence.

max_value.description: The maximum value of a sequence.

min_value.description: The minimum value of a sequence.

name.description: The name of a sequence.

owner_column.description: The owner column of the sequence.

owner_table.description: The owner table of the sequence.

skip_dump.description: Whether to skip this sequence during schema dump operations.

start.description: The start value of a sequence.

bytebase.v1.SpatialIndexConfig.schema.st.description: SpatialIndexConfig defines the spatial index configuration for spatial databases.

tessellation.description: Tessellation configuration for grid-based spatial indexes

bytebase.v1.SpatialIndexConfig.schema.st.title: Spatial Index Config

bytebase.v1.StorageConfig.schema.strict..description: StorageConfig defines storage and performance parameters for spatial indexes.

buffering.description: Buffering mode for PostgreSQL (auto, on, off)

bytebase.v1.StorageConfig.schema.strict..title: Storage Config

name.description: The name is the name of a stream.

stale.description: Indicates whether the stream was last read before the `stale_after` time.

table_name.description: The table_name is the name of the table/view that the stream is created on.

bytebase.v1.TableMetadata.schema.strict..description: TableMetadata is the metadata for tables.

check_constraints.description: The check_constraints is the list of check constraints in a table.

collation.description: The collation is the collation of a table.

columns.description: The columns is the ordered list of columns in a table.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a table.

create_options.description: The create_options is the create option of a table.

data_free.description: The data_free is the estimated free data size of a table.

data_size.description: The data_size is the estimated data size of a table.

engine.description: The engine is the engine of a table.

foreign_keys.description: The foreign_keys is the list of foreign keys in a table.

index_size.description: The index_size is the estimated index size of a table.

indexes.description: The indexes is the list of indexes in a table.

name.description: The name is the name of a table.

partitions.description: The partitions is the list of partitions in a table.

row_count.description: The row_count is the estimated number of rows of a table.

skip_dump.description: Whether to skip this table during schema dump operations.

sorting_keys.description:
The sorting_keys is a tuple of column names or arbitrary expressions. ClickHouse specific field.
 Reference: https://clickhouse.com/docs/en/engines/table-engines/mergetree-family/mergetree#order_by

triggers.description: The triggers is the list of triggers associated with the table.

bytebase.v1.TableMetadata.schema.strict..title: Table Metadata

bytebase.v1.TablePartitionMetadata.schem.description: TablePartitionMetadata is the metadata for table partitions.

expression.description:
The expression is the expression of a table partition.
 For PostgreSQL, the expression is the text of {FOR VALUES
 partition_bound_spec}, see
 https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-createtable.html. For MySQL,
 the expression is the `expr` or `column_list` of the following syntax.
 PARTITION BY
    { [LINEAR] HASH(expr)
    | [LINEAR] KEY [ALGORITHM={1 | 2}] (column_list)
    | RANGE{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)}
    | LIST{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)} }.

name.description: The name is the name of a table partition.

subpartitions.description: The subpartitions is the list of subpartitions in a table partition.

type.description: The type of a table partition.
type.title: Type

use_default.description:
The use_default is whether the users use the default partition, it stores
 the different value for different database engines. For MySQL, it's [INT]
 type, 0 means not use default partition, otherwise, it's equals to number
 in syntax [SUB]PARTITION {number}.

value.description:
The value is the value of a table partition.
 For MySQL, the value is for RANGE and LIST partition types,
 - For a RANGE partition, it contains the value set in the partition's
 VALUES LESS THAN clause, which can be either an integer or MAXVALUE.
 - For a LIST partition, this column contains the values defined in the
 partition's VALUES IN clause, which is a list of comma-separated integer
 values.
 - For others, it's an empty string.

bytebase.v1.TablePartitionMetadata.schem.title: Table Partition Metadata

id.description:
The id is the snowflake-generated id of a task.
 Example: 01ad32a0-1bb6-5e93-0000-000000000001

name.description: The name is the name of a task.

predecessors.description: The predecessor tasks of the task.

schedule.description: The schedule interval of the task.

bytebase.v1.TessellationConfig.schema.st.description: TessellationConfig defines tessellation parameters for spatial indexes.

bounding_box.description: Bounding box for GEOMETRY tessellation (not used for GEOGRAPHY)

cells_per_object.description: Number of cells per object (1-8192 for SQL Server)

grid_levels.description: Grid levels and densities for multi-level tessellation

bytebase.v1.TessellationConfig.schema.st.title: Tessellation Config

body.description: The body is the body of the trigger.

character_set_client.description: The character set used by the client creating the trigger.

collation_connection.description: The collation used for the connection when creating the trigger.

event.description:
The event is the event of the trigger, such as INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE,
 TRUNCATE.

name.description: The name is the name of the trigger.

skip_dump.description: Whether to skip this trigger during schema dump operations.

sql_mode.description: The SQL mode setting for the trigger.

timing.description: The timing is the timing of the trigger, such as BEFORE, AFTER.

bytebase.v1.ViewMetadata.schema.strict.j.description: ViewMetadata is the metadata for views.

columns.description: The columns is the ordered list of columns in a table.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of a view.

definition.description: The definition is the definition of a view.

dependency_columns.description: The dependency_columns is the list of dependency columns of a view.

name.description: The name is the name of a view.

triggers.description: The triggers is the list of triggers in a view.

bytebase.v1.ViewMetadata.schema.strict.j.title: View Metadata
